posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Druid Devastator 

Haven't seen a lot of Druid / RDDs
I think this is an underexplored build concept. 
Druids have outstanding crowd control abilities with Stonehold, Grease, Entangle and SoV.
I honestly get sick of my druids having to polymorph in and out of forms all the time.
Sometimes I just want to be in druid form to cast spells. Polymorphs for situational usage (ie Water Elementals are mind immune, and petrify immune and can fight rust monsters without a care...)

Here I take a Druid 28 / Bard 2 / RDD 10 split
It has a Str of 34, Base AB of 41 and 400 HP with a full 'undispellable Druid Spell Book, high Concentration/Discipline/Spot/Tumble 40/UMD 33/Spellcraft 30 mod etc.
With the Weapon Proficiency Druid containing Scimitar, I take WF/EWF: Scimitar and IC/OC/Devastating Critical: Scimitar
I give up any dream of Dragon Shape, the Wis 30+ requirement is just too expensive for me.
I do use one bonus great wisdom feat from Druid 24 to access level 9 druid spells which I viewed as a small trade off for a 'spellblade' to free up an extra epic feat but one can obviously adjust this to taste (ie if you want faster Druid 9 spells then get an extra point of wis early and change epic fort or epic prowess for great strength, for example.

Druids have great stat capping abilities in Bull's, Blood Frenzy, Aura of Vitality. One could swap Craft wand or Heavy Armor for Extend Spell in the build if desired. 

In terms of previous Druid / Bard / RDDs there are two builds total I could find in the ECB Archives (two) and ECB Filter Search (none):

Morphea Draca druid 22 / bard 8 / red dragon disciple 10 (human?) by sketchy_c
A Quite (devastating) Critical Dragon druid 29 / bard 1 / red dragon disciple 10 (half-orc?) by Dennis05

One doesn't work as Dragons have creature weapons and cannot dev crit. The other gets Dragon Shape and is a Zen Archer with a longbow. 

Anyway this one looks good, so feel free to have a look and comment if desired
SpoilerDruid(28), Bard(2), Red Dragon Disciple(10), Human STR: 16 (34) CON: 12 (14) INT: 14 (16) 01: Druid(1): Armor Proficiency Heavy, Power Attack 03: Druid(3): Cleave 05: Druid(5) 07: Druid(7) 09: Druid(9): Knockdown 11: Druid(11) 13: Druid(13) 15: Druid(15): Improved Critical: Scimitar 17: Druid(17) 19: Druid(19) 21: Druid(21): Epic Weapon Focus: Scimitar 23: Druid(23) 25: Bard(1) 27: Red Dragon Disciple(2): Epic Prowess, (STR=22) 29: Red Dragon Disciple(4): (STR=25) 31: Red Dragon Disciple(6) 33: Red Dragon Disciple(8): Devastating Critical: Scimitar 35: Red Dragon Disciple(10): {Darkvision}, (STR=30), (CHA=10) 37: Bard(2) 39: Druid(27): Great Strength II, (STR=33) Skillpoints: 287 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +6, Fear: +2 AB (max, naked): 41 (melee), 25 (ranged) Spell Casting: Druid(9),Bard(0) 01: Animal Empathy(1), Concentration(4), Disable Trap(1), Lore(4), Open Lock(1), Set Trap(1), Spellcraft(4), Save(9),  03: Concentration(1), Lore(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(17),  05: Concentration(1), Lore(1), Save(27),  07: Concentration(1), Save(39),  09: Concentration(1), Save(51),  11: Concentration(1), Save(63),  13: Concentration(1), Save(75),  15: Concentration(1), Save(87),  17: Concentration(1), Save(99),  19: Concentration(1), Save(111),  21: Concentration(1), Save(123),  23: Concentration(1), Save(135),  25: Concentration(1), Discipline(28), Taunt(28), Tumble(25), UMD(28), Save(38),  27: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Spot(1), Save(3),  29: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Spot(1), Save(7),  31: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Spot(1), Save(11),  33: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Spot(1), Save(15),  35: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Spot(1), Save(20),  37: Concentration(1), Discipline(2), Taunt(12), Tumble(15), UMD(5),  39: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(7),

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I suppose Druid/RDD is not very popular to build with because RDD doesn't bring anything major to Druid.

You give up 11 levels of Druid caster levels and a lot of Great Wisdoms for...what?

Str, ayup (the obvious one with RDD).  A bit of Int, sort of useful (skill points), but that comes pretty late in your build.  Immunity to Fire - but aren't Fire Elementals immune to fire?  Red Dragons as well?

You do get some Con and better HD, but that really comes late.

Wings...hmmm.

I think this is the reason why RDD is not mixed much with Druid.  What is your build really getting from 10 levels of RDD?  The Bard level is rather obvious, I think.  UMD, Tumble.

Why did you only take 1 point in Animal Empathy?

I am curious to see how your build goes, if you decide to test it.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Mar 21, 2020
I suppose Druid/RDD is not very popular to build with because RDD doesn't bring anything major to Druid.

You give up 11 levels of Druid caster levels and a lot of Great Wisdoms for...what?

Str, ayup (the obvious one with RDD).  A bit of Int, sort of useful (skill points), but that comes pretty late in your build.  Immunity to Fire - but aren't Fire Elementals immune to fire?  Red Dragons as well?

You do get some Con and better HD, but that really comes late.

Wings...hmmm.

I think this is the reason why RDD is not mixed much with Druid.  What is your build really getting from 10 levels of RDD?  The Bard level is rather obvious, I think.  UMD, Tumble.

Why did you only take 1 point in Animal Empathy?

I am curious to see how your build goes, if you decide to test it.
I think Druid/RDD is not popular because Cleric/RDD, Bard/RDD, Fighter/RDD are much more popular with higher AB and more attacks / round.  Druid builds also have polymorph in them which to maximize, one will want Monk for the extra APR + Wis AC. Druid/Monk rules out RDD. RDD has +8 Str (+4 AB +4DMG +4 Dev Crit DC), +2 Con (+1 Fort, +40hp), +4 AC, Fire Immunity its great as always.

Druids do have some great spells, such as Stonehold/Grease/Entangle/SoV which disables and can destroy Dex/Tumble/Dodge AC for maybe -10 to -20 AC to opponents? Haven't done the math here but I believe it will be quite effective. 
Basically I am making a build which enemies have to fight the Druid with dev crit in his own powerful environmental pit at the cost of spell DC/Wisdom which is capped by Owl's Insight anyway.  
28 CL means 85% chance of beating max toolset SR 32, the loss of CLs is fine with a dev crit scimitar druid with Base 41 AB, you get something else in exchange. It looks exciting to me.
I did try a close to pure druid/fighter/rogue version of this build but the AB just ends up around 38-39 unless one goes half-orc which had other costs involved

The 1 point in AE is for Take 20 cheese to control certain wildlife, also there are gloves of animal empathy if you do want to use it in combat, it opens this up. you can drop it if you want

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
No, I am a great fan of Animal Empathy, and depending on the environment can be a huge advantage.

Grab that Summons from enemy X and put it to work for you.  Imagine the terror in your opponents eyes when that giant X turns against it!

Just wondering why the 1 skill point and not more, that is all.  I mean, RDD does bring a bit of Cha with it...

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Nice one. How much Animal Empathy do you put in your builds Web?
I personally have no idea what a good number is
What skill would you drop for it?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, this is the mechanic being dealt with :
  • Check: Animals and dire animals have a difficulty class of 15 + the creature's hit dice. For beasts and magical beasts, the DC is 19 + the creature's hit dice. If the check succeeds, the creature is dominated.
  • Special: If the character fails their check by five or more, the creature will go hostile.
  • Use: Select this skill (from the quickbar) and then select the target creature. Dominated creatures will be commanded as if they were henchmen. The creature will remain dominated for one turn per level of the character using the skill.
So it really depends on what one is facing in the environment as to how much to invest (also, what sort of Cha increasing stuff one has access to, and of course Animal Empathy skill increasing items, etc).

The "highest" animal summons is of course the Dire Tiger with 16 HD.  So that would be a DC of 15+16=31.  This is normally a mark to aim for if one is only interested in grabbing an opponents summons to use against them (I think this will also work on Animal Companions and Familiars if animals or beasts or magical beasts, but may require even a higher skill level).

Depending on the environment, one may really want to pump it as high as possible to get the best possible murder beast.

Let's take, for example, a Giant Cave Bear, a murderous weapon of mass destruction.  It has 30 HD for this example.  So as a normal Animal, it has a DC of 15+30=45. 

Magical Beasts, like Ankhegs would use the DC of 19+HD, of course.  Or Purple Worms...

"You talking to me?  Talk to the Worm first! Oh, and it doesn't understand Common!"

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I can see where you are coming from Web
It is tricky to drop anything in the build skill wise, probably it would be Taunt but that is needed to help with dropping the AC when your spells don't work. Or Discipline, but that protects against disarms/called shots and helps resist knockdowns if you don't have Knockdown Immunity.
Perhaps a future build I can put in a modified 31 Animal Empathy
I'll leave it at 1 though, just in case there are some uber AE gloves or something in the environment you are in, with possibly a bard buffing you. 
I understand the skill cap is +50 so there is a bit of leeway

Build is very easy to play btw. Level 12 very quickly, solo run Ruskis, did Orcs for fun and for some WF chests, did a party run through Dragon Cult Pt 1.

Its like a scimitar wielding fighter running around in full plate and tower with an entourage of rabid bears (or whatever animals you like) flank attacking enemies tearing them apart
The key is my AC is about 10-20 points higher than my summons, so if I can tank for them the more value I can get out of them, especially with Greater Magic Fang + Awaken.

I anticipate it will get easier to play epics with dev crit scimitar and huge AB/AC boost from RDD than most Druid builds who suffer from levels 22-early to mid 30 until they get Dragon Shape
I never really liked that part of the Druid/Monk Wisdom Shape Focused Druid.

Here's a few screenshots from playtesting, for your enjoyment.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The only reason you don't often see Druid devastators is because Cleric ones are seen as better Orion.  And while this is partially true, Druids have some tricks up their sleeves that Clerics don't have, so, If I were in your shoes I would point-out these differences as much as I could.

Here, for example, you could change "craft wand, knockdown & epic fortitude" for ESF: Conjuration to emphasize the Druid aspect of your build. Some might say it is fruitless to give ESF to a character with base 20 WIS but I disagree with this -one size fits all- approach.  You see, Stonehold is a Will saving throw AoE save-or-suck spell & for most melee monsters this is their weakest point by far, even on epic levels. Your max Stonehold DC (33) will destroy them with ease & you will be running through them & dev -crit, after dev-crit, after dev-crit... Show them how fair spell-casting is ;)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I really do want to fit SF/GSF and possibly ESF: Conjuration into this build for the Grease / Stonehold / SoV massive AoE Druid Bomb

Thanks for providing your insights Valefor as to one way how it might be done

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Can you fit Vinemine in there as well? And Creeping Doom?

Might as well go ALL IN!

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Heh Web on top of the Grease/Stonehold/SoV, for my caster druid I would sometimes add Entangle
One could conceivably add Nature's Balance then start spamming spells like Call Lightning, Ice Storm, Flame Strike
Druid has a nice toolkit against mobs

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
I really like this build Orion, thank you for sharing.

I can't comment on it though, as I don't have the knowledge or play experience.

This build shows the possibilities of the Druid. And I am assuming you are playtesting the build on WoG? If yes, it is a great place to even allow such unique builds.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for your comment SnorriHT, encouragement is always valued as well as critique!
Yes I play-test all my builds on WoG, it is a great place to test builds, its challenging solo, lots of players happy to party, content close to 40, dev crit enabled, etc
With the play-testing its more to make sure I have the balance of all the elements of the build pretty good

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I agree, WoG is a great place to stress-test builds.

I would like to hear more about your adventures with this build.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Really humbled by your interest.

Here's a few screenshots during a solo hill giants run.
Was a straightforward run learnt a lot during it.


Manfighting the big boss. No need for greater water elemental to tank for me. 


Wands of call lightning are nice against low reflex saves being party friendly and all. 
As are Wands of Summon IV, that Dire Bear on the left is there to assist with damage to help save some of my big summons for later.
Within all the chaos you may observe a certain 'glowing' scimitar 


Enemies can't fight back when they are encased in stone for 15+ rounds 
Including mages, they can't cast spells...
Not sure how much AC they lose here, it would be dex/tumble and dodge that gets disabled here. 
The AC loss probably gets better as one advances in level

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: Druids are the perfect companion for archers and archer/rogues, or even all rogue types if the Druid grants his compatriot some Freedom.
